Title: President Aliyev highlights deportations of Azerbaijanis in 20th ...
Description: On September 30, Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev, along with his son Heydar Aliyev, participated in the unveiling ceremony of a statue of the prominent figure of Azerbaijani ashiq art and great folk artist, Ashiq Alasgar, in Baku.

Title: Russia to call up 133,000 conscripts for military service in fall...
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has signed a decree to mobilize 133,000 conscripts for military service as part of the upcoming fall campaign, according to a statement posted on the government's legal information portal on Monday.

Title: Iran opens first overseas trade center in Armenia
Description: Iran’s first and largest overseas trade center was commissioned in Armenia on Monday.

Title: Azerbaijan promotes tourism potential in Japan
Description: Azerbaijan's tourism potential was prominently featured at the Tourism Expo Japan 2024, held in Tokyo from September 26 to 29.

Title: French forward Griezmann retires from international football
Description: Antoine Griezmann, the forward for Atlético Madrid, has announced his retirement from the French national team, expressing 'deep emotion' in his decision.

Title: UK ending 142-year coal power era
Description: The UK is set to cease all electricity production from coal, ending its 142-year reliance on the fossil fuel.

Title: Azerbaijani servicemen undergo engineering training on modern equ...
Description: As part of the 2024 training plan, Azerbaijan’s Defense Ministry conducted practical demonstration classes on engineering training for commanders and their deputies.

Title: President Aliyev congratulates Jewish community of Azerbaijan
Description: President Ilham Aliyev congratulated the Jewish community of Azerbaijan on the occasion of Rosh Hashanah.

Title: Typhoon Krathon batters Philippine islands, heads toward Taiwan
Description: Typhoon Krathon struck a remote group of Philippine islands near Taiwan on Monday, causing power outages and communication disruptions, according to the state weather service.

Title: Tehran outlines conditions for continuing talks with IAEA
Description: Tehran on Monday outlined its conditions for continuing talks with the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA).

Title: Western Azerbaijan Community deplores anti-Azerbaijani activities...
Description: As COP29 approaches, the notorious anti-Azerbaijani forces have stepped up their attacks on Azerbaijan under the pretext of 'human rights,' the Western Azerbaijan Community said in a statement on Monday.

Title: US set to announce new tariffs on solar panels from Southeast Asi...
Description: U.S. trade officials are expected to announce new tariffs this week on solar panels imported from four Southeast Asian nations.

Title: Slovakia explores partnership with South Korea for new nuclear po...
Description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico discussed plans to build a new nuclear power unit during a visit to South Korea, as the Slovak government seeks potential bidders for the project.

Title: Israel sets conditions for potential ceasefire with Hezbollah
Description: Israeli Foreign Minister Israel Katz has communicated to his counterparts in 25 countries that enforcing United Nations Resolution 1701 is a prerequisite for any truce with Lebanon's Hezbollah.

Title: Ukraine claims destruction of 67 more Russian drones
Description: Ukraine said early Monday that its forces successfully downed 67 Russian drones across 11 regions, including the capital, Kyiv.

Title: Azerbaijan’s non-oil sector achieves significant growth
Description: Azerbaijan's non-oil and gas sector has achieved significant growth of 7% in the first eight months of 2024, according to the country’s Economy Minister Mikayil Jabbarov.

Title: Wait for it', Iran again vows retaliation against Israel
Description: Iran vowed a tough retaliation against Israel for the killing of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah.

Title: Azerbaijan’s parliament opens autumn session
Description: Azerbaijan’s seventh convocation Milli Majlis (Parliament) on Monday convened the first meeting of its autumn session.

Title: Switzerland, Italy redefine Alpine border due to melting glaciers
Description: Switzerland and Italy have officially redrawn part of their border in the Alps due to the effects of climate change, particularly the melting of glaciers.

Title: Azerbaijan starts construction of new closed-type substation in K...
Description: Azerbaijan’s Azerenerji OJSC has launched the construction of a new closed-type substation in the city of Khankendi.

Title: Musk claims Democrats will destroy US Constitution if they win up...
Description: US entrepreneur and billionaire Elon Musk has expressed his belief that the Democrats will destroy the country’s Constitution if their candidate wins the upcoming presidential election.

Title: Musk claims Democrats will undermine US constitution if elected i...
Description: US entrepreneur and billionaire Elon Musk has expressed his belief that the Democrats will undermine the country’s Constitution if their candidate wins the upcoming presidential election.

Title: Azerbaijani referee to officiate UEFA Champions League match
Description: Azerbaijan’s FIFA referee Aliyar Aghayev has been appointed to officiate the UEFA Champions League matchday 2 game between Sturm Graz (Austria) and Club Brugge (Belgium).

Title: Russia sticks to LNG production goals despite Western sanctions
Description: Russia is committed to increasing its liquefied natural gas (LNG) production to over 100 million tons by 2035 despite the ongoing Western sanctions, the country’s energy minister said on Monday.

Title: Azerbaijan improves standing in global broadband internet speed r...
Description: In August 2024, Azerbaijan ranked 104th out of 161 countries for fixed broadband internet speed, with an average download speed of 45.47 Mbps, according to the Speedtest Global Index.

Title: UAE Diplomat’s residence attacked in Sudan
Description: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has condemned an attack on its diplomat’s residence in Khartoum, after a Sudanese army aircraft attacked the building in what Abu Dhabi termed 'a cowardly act,' in a statement on Monday, News.az reports citing Kenyan Wall Street .

Title: Russia’s Putin reaffirms commitment to achieve goals in Ukraine w...
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin declared on Monday that Moscow will achieve all its objectives in the ongoing war against Ukraine.

Title: Japan braces for two typhoons
Description: Typhoon Jebi is expected to impact eastern Japan, including Tokyo, in the coming days as the 17th typhoon of the year approaches the Ogasawara Islands to the south, according to the weather agency's announcement.

Title: South Korea sees rapid decline in its chip stockpiles
Description: South Korea’s semiconductor stockpiles fell at the fastest rate since 2009 last month, indicating strong and sustained demand for high-performance memory chips used in artificial intelligence development.

Title: Israeli airstrike hits central Beirut for the first time since la...
Description: Israeli forces launched an airstrike early Monday in the Kola area of Beirut, marking the first attack within the Lebanese capital since the conflict with Hezbollah escalated last October.

Title: Azerbaijan submits bid to host UN Biodiversity Conference
Description: Azerbaijan has officially submitted its bid to host the 17th Conference of the Parties to the UN Convention on Biological Diversity in 2026.

Title: US approves $567 mln in defense aid for Taiwan
Description: The White House announced late Sunday the approval by President Joe Biden $567 million in defense support for Taiwan.

Title: Germany prepares for War: Key NATO military installations strengt...
Description: By Samir Muradov Amid growing geopolitical tensions in Europe, Germany is ramping up its military activities by conducting large-scale exercises under the name Red Storm. These maneuvers by the Bundeswehr, Germany’s armed forces, are designed to train the defense of strategic infrastructure and ensure operational coordination in the event of a potential conflict. This is happening against the backdrop of concerns about a possible escalation of war in Europe within the next five years.

Title: Azerbaijan's amphibious aircraft continues firefighting ops in wi...
Description: Under President Ilham Aliyev's instructions, Azerbaijan’s Ministry of Emergency Situations (MES) deployed 'BE-200CS' amphibious aircraft to assist Türkiye in combating the ongoing severe forest fires.

Title: Baku hosts Climate Action Week ahead of COP29
Description: The Baku Climate Action Week has kicked off in the Azerbaijani capital.

Title: Tokyo’s call to Washington: Japan prepares for nuclear deterrence...
Description: With Shigeru Ishiba’s appointment as Prime Minister of Japan on October 1, 2024, the country embarks on a new era of foreign policy and military strategy. In his article for the Hudson Institute in Washington, Ishiba called for a discussion on the possibility of deploying U.S. nuclear weapons in the Asia-Pacific region (APR) and creating an Asian equivalent of NATO. This initiative not only shifts the direction of Japanese policy but also raises questions about the nation’s remilitarization and its consequences for the entire region.

Title: Hamas confirms death of its Lebanon chief in Israeli airstrike
Description: The head of the headquarters of the Palestinian Hamas movement in Lebanon, Fathi al-Sharif, has been killed in an Israeli airstrike in the south of the country.

Title: Azerbaijan’s liberated Jabrayil welcomes back another 40 families
Description: Under President Ilham Aliyev’s instructions, another group of former IDPs were relocated to Azerbaijan's liberated Jabrayil city on Monday as part of the Great Return program.

Title: Massive smoke plume from Georgia chemical plant fire triggers eva...
Description: A towering plume of black smoke from a fire at a chemical plant in the US state of Georgia has forced evacuations as scientists work to determine its contents.

Title: Chinese stocks surge to highest since 2015
Description: Chinese stocks continued one of the most dramatic comebacks in history, rising for the ninth consecutive day as government stimulus measures attracted investors back to one of the world's most undervalued markets.

Title: Israel strikes Houthi targets in Yemen
Description: The Israeli Air Force (IAF) has conducted airstrikes on Houthi targets in Yemen in response to their recent attacks against Israel.

Title: President Aliyev: Azerbaijan values its longstanding relationship...
Description: Azerbaijan highly appreciates its longstanding relationship with the International Association of Prosecutors and believe it is important to strengthen efforts to further solidify this partnership, President Ilham Aliyev said in his message to the participants of the 29th Annual Conference and General Meeting of the International Association of Prosecutors.

Title: Southeastern US begins recovery as death toll nears 100 after Hur...
Description: The Southeastern United States launched a massive cleanup and recovery operation on Sunday as the death toll rose to nearly 100 following the devastation caused by Hurricane Helene.

Title: SpaceX capsule docks at ISS to rescue stranded astronauts
Description: A SpaceX Dragon capsule has successfully docked with the International Space Station (ISS) to bring back two stranded astronauts, Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams.

Title: Japan's new LDP leader to call general election for Oct. 27
Description: Shigeru Ishiba, Japan's newly elected leader of the ruling Liberal Democratic Party and soon-to-be prime minister, has announced plans to hold a general election on October 27.

Title: Hezbollah names its new leader
Description: Hashem Safieddine, a prominent figure in Hezbollah's leadership, has reportedly been named by the group's executive council as the successor to Hassan Nasrallah as Secretary General.

Title: How to hold Armenia accountable for occupation: Reparations
Description: On September 23, during the first session of the VII convocation of the Milli Majlis of the Republic of Azerbaijan, President Ilham Aliyev addressed several messages to Armenia and the international community. Among them, he highlighted the contrast between the fate of Nazi Germany after World War II and that of another fascist state—Armenia.

Title: Egypt reports $6 bln loss in Suez Canal revenue amid geopolitical...
Description: Egypt has experienced a significant revenue loss of $6 billion from the Suez Canal due to rising geopolitical tensions in the region, President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi announced on Sunday.

Title: Hezbollah confirms deaths of two senior figures in Israeli airstr...
Description: Hezbollah has announced the deaths of two of its leaders due to Israeli airstrikes in the southern suburbs of Beirut.

Title: Hurricane John hits Mexico, claiming at least 22 lives
Description: Residents in southwestern Mexico evacuated their homes on Saturday as flooding from the remnants of Hurricane John, which battered the Pacific coastline for a week, led to deadly floods and landslides. The storm has resulted in at least 22 confirmed fatalities.

Title: Azerbaijani FM, UN chief discuss Baku-Yerevan peace process
Description: Azerbaijan’s Foreign Minister Jeyhun Bayramov held a meeting with UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres in New York.

Title: Israel claims to have killed another senior Hezbollah official
Description: The Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) announced Sunday it had killed Nabil Kaouk, a top Hezbollah official.

Title: US weighs new troops deployment in Middle East
Description: The United States is reportedly considering deploying more troops to the Middle East.

Title: Israel conducts airstrikes on multiple Hezbollah targets in Leban...
Description: The Israeli Air Force (IAF) has conducted strikes against numerous Hezbollah targets in Lebanon in early Sunday.

Title: Drone attack targets US military base in eastern Syria
Description: Massive explosions rocked a U.S. military base in the Koniko oil field in eastern Syria on Sunday following a drone attack involving suicide drones.

Title: Türkiye condemns US extension of arms embargo lift for Greek Cypr...
Description: On Saturday, Türkiye strongly criticized the U.S. decision to extend the lifting of the arms embargo on the Greek Cypriot Administration for another year, calling it a 'serious mistake.'

Title: China and Uganda launch the largest hydropower project
Description: Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni inaugurated the 600-megawatt Karuma Hydropower Station and Karuma Interconnection Project, both constructed by China, in Kiryandongo district. The event, held on Thursday, was attended by Uganda’s Vice President Jessica Alupo, ministers, senior officials, and international development partners, News.Az reports.

Title: COP29 ‘opportunity’ to contribute to global peace, climate agenda...
Description: The upcoming COP29 in Baku will be an opportunity to set differences aside and contribute to global peace and the climate agenda, Azerbaijan’s Foreign Minister Jeyhun Bayramov said.

Title: ISW assessment of the Russian offensive campaign, September 28, 2...
Description: Western officials have once again emphasized the ongoing efforts by the People's Republic of China (PRC) to provide support to Russia in its war against Ukraine . This assistance comes amid a series of significant developments on the battlefield, News.Az reports.

Title: Armenian troops fire at Azerbaijani positions in Nakhchivan
Description: Armenian armed forces opened fire at the Azerbaijani Army’s positions in the direction of the Nakhchivan Autonomous Republic.

Title: Israeli soldiers abduct two Palestinians in Bethlehem
Description: Early Sunday morning, Israeli soldiers abducted two Palestinians from their homes in Bethlehem, situated in the occupied West Bank, News.Az reports.

Title: Nepal shuts schools following heavy rains that claim 100 lives
Description: Nepal has closed schools for three days following landslides and floods caused by two days of heavy rainfall, which have claimed 100 lives and left 67 people missing, officials reported on Sunday.
